title: original Toronto street signs
content: What’s the typeface used to make the original ‘classic’ Toronto street signs, ie the ones mostly downtown, embossed black on white background? Can someone steer me in the right direction? Help!
author: ptanzola

comments.content:
Do you mean [like this](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111224447/http:/www.boldts.net/photos/TorFd.4.jpeg)?

If so, it’s [Korinna Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111224447/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.108267.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Fashion+District&sampleSize=32&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14) for the top and something like [Interstate Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111224447/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.8029.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=CLARENCE+SQ.&sampleSize=48&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14) for the bottom.

- Lex
